title-part.text: WALL, FLOOR, OR LIKE COVERING MATERIALS, e.g. LINOLEUM, OILCLOTH, ARTIFICIAL LEATHER, ROOFING FELT, CONSISTING OF A FIBROUS WEB COATED WITH A LAYER OF MACROMOLECULAR MATERIAL
FLEXIBLE SHEET MATERIAL NOT OTHERWISE PROVIDED FOR

note.note-paragraph: Layered products classified in this subclass are also classified in subclass B32B.

The following IPC groups are not in the CPC scheme. The subject matter for these IPC groups is classified in the following CPC groups:
D06N7/02 covered by D06N7/0002 – D06N7/0097
D06N7/04 covered by D06N7/0002 – D06N7/0097
D06N7/06 covered by D06N7/0002 – D06N7/0097
In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

CPC-specific-text.text: , e.g. linoxyn, polymerised or oxidised resin
other

title-part.text: material obtained by covering fibrous webs with macromolecular material, e.g. resins, rubber or derivatives thereof

CPC-specific-text.text: characterised by the substrate
using ultra-fine two-component fibres, e.g. island/sea, or ultra-fine one component fibres (< 1 denier)
using woven fabrics
using knitted fabrics
using non-woven fabrics
using multilayer webs
using fibres of specified chemical or physical nature, e.g. natural silk
Collagen fibres or collagen on fibres
Asbestos fibres
Glass fibres
Rubber threads; Elastomeric fibres; Stretchable, bulked or crimped fibres; Retractable, crimpable fibres; Shrinking or stretching of fibres during manufacture; Obliquely threaded fabrics
Rubber or elastomeric fibres
Stretchable fibres; Stretching of fibres during manufacture
Retractable fibres; Shrinking of fibres during manufacture
Polyamide fibres
Polyester fibres
Polyolefin fibres
using flocked webs or pile fabrics upon which a resin is applied; Teasing, raising web before resin application
characterised by their foraminous structure; Characteristics of the foamed layer or of cellular layers

reference.text: foraminous structure obtained by stretching D06N3/0029

CPC-specific-text.text: obtained by applying a ready-made foam layer; obtained by compressing, crinkling or crushing a foam layer, e.g. Kaschierverfahren für Schaumschicht
obtained by incorporating air, i.e. froth
obtained by blowing or swelling agent
obtained by leaching out of a compound, e.g. water soluble salts, fibres or fillers; obtained by freezing or sublimation; obtained by eliminating drops of sublimable fluid
obtained by mechanical perforations
characterised by the compounding ingredients of the macro-molecular coating
Organic ingredients with special effects, e.g. oil- or water-repellent, antimicrobial, flame-resistant, magnetic, bactericidal, odour-influencing agents; perfumes
Organic fillers or organic fibrous fillers, e.g. ground leather waste, wood bark, cork powder, vegetable flour; Other organic compounding ingredients; Post-treatment with organic compounds
Inorganic compounding ingredients, e.g. metals, carbon fibres, Na2CO3, metal layers; Post-treatment with inorganic compounds
Organic pigments, e.g. dyes, brighteners
Polymeric granules, particles or powder, e.g. core-shell particles, microcapsules
characterised by mechanical or physical treatments
Slicing; Manufacturing two webs at one time
Napping, teasing, raising or abrading of the resin coating

reference.text: raising, napping of the web before coating D06N3/004

CPC-specific-text.text: Embossing; Pressing of the surface; Tumbling and crumbling; Cracking; Cooling; Heating, e.g. mirror finish
Suction, vacuum treatment
by wave energy or particle radiation
by electrical processes, e.g. potentials, corona discharge, electrophoresis, electrolytic
characterised by the application technique
by directly applying the resin
by spraying components on the web
by applying resin powders; by sintering
by inversion technique; by transfer processes
Release surface, e.g. separation sheets; Silicone papers

title-part.text: with macromolecular compounds obtained by reactions only involving carbon-to-carbon unsaturated bonds

with polyolefin or polystyrene (co-)polymers
with fluoropolymers

or other synthetic rubbers or elastomers except polyurethanes

Elastomers

with polyesters, polycarbonates, alkyds
with polyesters

Poly-amino acids, e.g. polyglutamates
with silicon polymers

mixture of polyurethanes with other resins in the same layer

with polyurethane and polymerisation products, e.g. acrylics, PVC
two or more layers of polyurethanes
characterised by the macromolecular diols used
characterised by the isocyanates used
(cyclo)aliphatic polyisocyanates
, i.e. drying oil varnishes, preferably linseed-oil-based; factice (sulfurised oils), Turkish birdlime, resinates reacted with drying oils; naphthenic metal salts

title-part.text: with two layers of different macromolecular materials

reference.text: with two layers of the same kind of macromolecular material D06N2213/03

CPC-specific-text.text: the layers are one next to the other
one of the layers is on one surface of the fibrous web and the other layer is on the other surface of the fibrous web
Roofing materials comprising a fibrous web coated with bitumen or another polymer, e.g. pitch

reference.text: compositions of bituminous materials C08L95/00, roof covering E04D5/00, roofing underlays E04D12/002

CPC-specific-text.text: coated with bitumen
characterised by the means to apply it to a support or to another roofing membrane, e.g. self-adhesive layer or strip

title-part.text: Flexible sheet materials not otherwise provided for, e.g. textile threads, filaments, yarns or tow, glued on macromolecular material

reference.text: paper-based or board-based structures for surface covering D21H27/20

CPC-specific-text.text: Wallpaper or wall covering on textile basis
Floor covering on textile basis comprising a fibrous substrate being coated with at least one layer of a polymer on the top surface
characterised by their relief structure
obtained by mechanical embossing
obtained by chemical embossing (chemisches Prägen)
use of inhibitor for the blowing agent or inhibitor for the kicker, e.g. trimellitic anhydride, triazole
use of kicker for the blowing agent, e.g. Beschleunigungsverfahren
use of a swelling agent
obtained by physical means, e.g. differential heating or differential irradiation; masking certain areas during treating
obtained by moulding, e.g. moulding table (tapis moule)
characterised by colour effects, e.g. craquelé, reducing gloss
mixture of two or more dyes, pigments, brighteners in the same layer
two or more different colour layers
characterised by their backing, e.g. secondary backing, back-sizing
characterised by the physical or chemical aspects of the layers
Conductive or insulating layers; Antistatic layers; Flame-proof layers
Sealing or barrier layers, e.g. against solvents, asphalt, plasticisers
Special extra layers under the surface coating, e.g. wire threads
Fibrous layer(s); Fibre reinforcement; Fibrous fillers
Compounding ingredients, e.g. rigid elements

reference.text: compounding ingredients of the macromolecular coating D06N3/0056

CPC-specific-text.text: Particulate material such as cork, rubber particles, reclaimed resin particles, magnetic particles, metal particles, glass beads
Layers obtained by sintering or glueing the granules together
characterised by the textile substrate as base web
Floor covering on textile basis comprising a fibrous top layer being coated at the back with at least one polymer layer, e.g. carpets, rugs, synthetic turf
characterised by the pile
characterised by the primary backing or the fibrous top layer
characterised by their backing, e.g. pre-coat, back coating, secondary backing, cushion backing
the back coating or pre-coat being applied as an aqueous dispersion or latex
the back coating or pre-coat being a thermoplastic material applied by, e.g. extrusion coating, powder coating or laminating a thermoplastic film
the back coating or pre-coat being applied as a hot melt
with at least one extra fibrous layer at the backing, e.g. stabilizing fibrous layer, fibrous secondary backing
with at least one layer obtained by sintering or bonding granules together
characterised by the cushion backing, e.g. foamed polyurethane
Underlays
Non-continuous polymer coating on the fibrous substrate, e.g. plastic dots on fabrics
Fibrous material being coated on one surface with at least one layer of an inorganic material and at least one layer of a macromolecular material
Web coated with fibres, e.g. flocked

title-part.text: Chemical constitution of the fibres, threads or yarns
Elastomeric, elastic fibres, e.g. spandex, lycra
Vinyl halide, e.g. PVC, PVDC, PVF, PVDF
Lignocellulosic fibres, e.g. jute, sisal, hemp, flax, bamboo
Animal fibres, e.g. hair, wool, silk
Fibres being in the form of a tape, strip or ribbon
Macromolecular materials of the coating layers
Natural macromolecular compounds or derivatives thereof
Macromolecular compounds obtained by reactions only involving carbon-to-carbon unsaturated bonds
Macromolecular compounds obtained otherwise than by reactions only involving carbon-to-carbon unsaturated bonds
Bituminous material, e.g. asphalt, tar, bitumen
Condition, form or state of the materials
Treatments by energy or chemical effects
by wave energy or particle radiation
using electromagnetic radiation, e.g. IR, UV, actinic light, laser, X-ray, gamma-ray, microwave, radio frequency
using particle radiation, e.g. ion, electron, neutron
on the layer surface, e.g. ink
within the layer by addition of a colorant, e.g. pigments, dyes
Resistant to mechanical forces, e.g. shock, impact, puncture, flexion, shear, compression, tear
Inert, i.e. inert to chemical degradation, corrosion resistant

reference.text: adhesive allowing removal of the whole carpet D06N2213/066; releasability between at least two layers of a carpet, rug or synthetic lawn D06N2213/068

title-part.text: Resistance to bacteria, mildew, mould, fungi
Resistive to light or to UV

reference.text: medical patches D06N2211/22; medical packaging D06N2211/20

title-part.text: Patches, e.g. medical patches, repair patches
All layers being of the same kind of material, e.g. all layers being of polyolefins, all layers being of polyesters
Fibrous web coated on one side with at least two layers of the same polymer type, e.g. two coatings of polyolefin
the coating layer does not completely close the openings between the fibres
Characteristics of the backing in carpets, rugs, synthetic lawn
Two back coatings one next to the other
having an adhesive on the undersurface to allow removal of the whole carpet, rug or synthetic lawn from the floor, e.g. pressure sensitive adhesive
Releasability between at least two of the layers
